item.title: MCEI "How To Write A Grant"
item.description: http://www.mceinstitute.ning.com Grants are not just free money, but require an investment in planning, resources, commitment, and sustainability. Applying for a grant can seem like a daunting task. Certainly, there is work involved, but with the help of this tutorial, you will know the steps that are necessary and find that success is not as hard to attain as you might think. Grants also have added benefits for the library in addition to funding, such as valuable partnerships, resolved community needs, and increased community support. This class will cover each phase in the grant writing and submission process: * Prepare - This lesson covers the process of preparing to write the grant. Topics discussed include building a team, finding partners, and designing sustainability. Includes a checklist and the six phases of grant writing. * Focus on Library Priorities - This lesson discusses how to focus on the priorities of your library, including identifying the needs and determining how your grant will make a difference. * Develop the Grant Project - This section covers the development of your grant. Includes elements of the project plan, evaluating the plan, and tools for evaluating the project. * Research Funders and Find Appropriate Grants - This section covers how to find funds. Includes grant resources, tips for finding funds, and how to interview with a funder. * Write the Grant Proposal - This section covers the process of actually writing the grant. Includes common components to be included in the grant and how to tell your story in the grant. * Implement, Evaluate and Continue the Process - This section covers the implementation of the funded project. Also included is how to evaluate the process and keeping up to date. This class addresses these issues and more in a web-class designed to take about 2.0 hours to complete. http://www.mceinstitute.ning.com In-Class Registration Fee: $30.00 Online Webinar Registration Fee: $20.00 Space is limited to 30 participants. You must Register by 02/01/10 to receive your webinar materials. Register at http://www.eventbrite.com/org/373767183 http://www.mceinstitute.ning.com
item.dc:creator: Vic Rivera
item.itunes:summary:
http://www.mceinstitute.ning.com
Grants are not just free money, but require an investment in planning, resources, commitment, and sustainability.
Applying for a grant can seem like a daunting task. Certainly, there is work involved, but with the help of this tutorial, you will know the steps that are necessary and find that success is not as hard to attain as you might think. Grants also have added benefits for the library in addition to funding, such as valuable partnerships, resolved community needs, and increased community support.
This class will cover each phase in the grant writing and submission process:
* Prepare - This lesson covers the process of preparing to write the grant. Topics discussed include building a team, finding partners, and designing sustainability. Includes a checklist and the six phases of grant writing.
* Focus on Library Priorities - This lesson discusses how to focus on the priorities of your library, including identifying the needs and determining how your grant will make a difference.
* Develop the Grant Project - This section covers the development of your grant. Includes elements of the project plan, evaluating the plan, and tools for evaluating the project.
* Research Funders and Find Appropriate Grants - This section covers how to find funds. Includes grant resources, tips for finding funds, and how to interview with a funder.
* Write the Grant Proposal - This section covers the process of actually writing the grant. Includes common components to be included in the grant and how to tell your story in the grant.
* Implement, Evaluate and Continue the Process - This section covers the implementation of the funded project. Also included is how to evaluate the process and keeping up to date.
This class addresses these issues and more in a web-class designed to take about 2.0 hours to complete.
http://www.mceinstitute.ning.com
In-Class Registration Fee: $30.00 Online Webinar Registration Fee: $20.00 Space is limited to 30 participants. You must Register by 02/01/10 to receive your webinar materials.
Register at http://www.eventbrite.com/org/373767183 http://www.mceinstitute.ning.com

item.title: MCEI "How To Operate QuickBooks For Your Organization"
item.description: http://www.mceinstitute.ning.com Would you buy a car without a speedometer or a gas gauge? You wouldn't consider it. When driving, you need to know how fast you drive and how much gas you have left. You don't want to get a ticket or run out of gas, so you watch the gauges on your dashboard. For your organization, you need to keep an eye on how much cash you have on hand to meet accounts payable and other expenses. As you drive a car, you make quick checks of its gauges to prevent problems. Whether you are a director or an employee, QuickBooks training gives you a competitive edge. It gives you the business tools to track what's working and where you can improve. If you don't know where your money is being earned and where you spend it, you are flying blind! We appreciate your interest in our classes and webinars and look forward to serving you! http://www.mceinstitute.ning.com Time: February 13, 2010 from 8am to 10am Location: Lord of Lights Worship Center Street: 5044 W. Diversey Avenue City/Town: Chicago Phone: 224.200.5427 Event Type: quickbooks, webinar, series, business Organized By: Rev. Victor L. Rivera, PhD. http://www.mceinstitute.ning.com
item.dc:creator: Vic Rivera
item.itunes:summary:
http://www.mceinstitute.ning.com
Would you buy a car without a speedometer or a gas gauge? You wouldn't consider it. When driving, you need to know how fast you drive and how much gas you have left. You don't want to get a ticket or run out of gas, so you watch the gauges on your dashboard.
For your organization, you need to keep an eye on how much cash you have on hand to meet accounts payable and other expenses. As you drive a car, you make quick checks of its gauges to prevent problems.
Whether you are a director or an employee, QuickBooks training gives you a competitive edge. It gives you the business tools to track what's working and where you can improve. If you don't know where your money is being earned and where you spend it, you are flying blind!
We appreciate your interest in our classes and webinars and look forward to serving you!
